intro: Sida quinqueloba, commonly known as the five-lobed mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial species that typically grows in moist, disturbed soils. The plant features palmate leaves with five lobes, and its flowers are pink or purple, with five petals. Sida quinqueloba belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. It is characterized by its showy blooms and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
